moves.3. d4 cxd4 4. Nxd4 e5 5. Nb5 a6 6. Nd6+: At the time I liked this move but now I think I like a queen move better.
moves.8. Bc4 O-O 9. Nc3 b5 10. Bd5: Thought about developing queen to b6 or bishop to b7 but didn´t like his bishop having an outpost so I decided to trade instead.
moves.10... Nxd5 11. Nxd5 Re8 12. O-O Re6: Don´t like the pressure of his queen so making him back off.
moves.13. Qa3 Bb7 14. Bd2 Nd4 15. Qd3 Bxd5: Once again removing a piece that has an outpost on that square. However I think this was not the best move because after capturing with pawn and forcing my rook to move I have no squares for my knight after pawn to c3.
moves.16. exd5 Rg6: Wanted to put some pressure on his king.
moves.17. Rae1 Qf6: I needed to protect pawn and allow knight to have an escape square after c3. This becomes a problem later being on the same file as rook.
moves.18. f3 Nf5: didn´t feel my knight was safe on the other square and wanted to relocate it as soon as possible.
moves.19. Bc3 d6 20. f4: After studying this position for a long time I felt like his attack was too strong and I was going to lose unless I slowed it down. My pieces were in really bad positions. I felt the following move a rook sacrifice was needed to save the game.
moves.20... Rxg2+ 21. Kxg2 Qg6+: moving queen out of bishop pin with tempo.
moves.22. Kf2 exf4 23. Rfg1 Qh5 24. Rg2 g6: needed to block either rook or bishop and felt this move was the better move as it also stops a future threat of rook to g1.
moves.25. Bd2 Nh4: Attacking rook in order to save pawn.
moves.26. Rgg1 f3 27. Rg5 Qh6: I realize he may have thoughts of a discovered threat but don´t see him having anything immediately and this move was practically forced.
moves.28. Re7 Kf8: I moved my king to unpin my pawn and attack his rook at the same time.
moves.29. Qe4 Nf5: Realize he blundered and acted on it.
moves.30. Rxf7+ Kxf7 31. Qe6+: in order to avoid losing queen to rook f5 I did not go to f8 but rather g7
moves.31... Kg7 32. Qxf5 Qxh2+: At this point I realize I have won the game.
moves.33. Ke3 Qe2+ 34. Kd4 Qxd2+ 35. Qd3: Here I had two options trade queens in order to avoid any chances of a draw knowing I had a winning position with my three passed pawns or go up a rook. I felt the queen trade was a simpler win though I believe I would have won taking the rook as well.
easy endgame win from here since my passed pawns can´t be stopped and king can´t even take a pawn without me queening the other passed pawn. So I just go straight to the side he has more pawns to create a threat on that side of the board as well winning the game.
moves.42... Ke5 43. c4: The only thing I needed to be careful about was capturing correctly so that he doesn´t create a passed pawn that my king can´t stop.
And here he resigns realizing he can´t stop  threats from both sides of the board neither capture the g5 pawn or lose to h pawn queening.
